content.description: A unique journey requiring some burl and some jamming skills. Climb out the low, v-groove roof feature over the water. Exit the roof and gain access to the sweeping crack that takes you to the top of the boulder. Don't fall in the brook! The landing is almost always wet except during extremely dry summers (when Norris Brook completely dries up).
content.location: Start in the obvious v-groove roof feature that hangs over the water.

content.description: Climbs the arete to the right of Green Lantern. Sit start under the overhang on good holds. Move up into a chockstone jug then left along the arete. Thin holds at the top make for an exciting finish.
content.location: Start on the arete just to the right of Green Lantern.

content.description: Climbs up through the big pocket on the back side of the boulder into a vertical crack leading to the slab on top of the boulder.
content.location: Right in the middle of the backside of the boulder (facing the self storage units).

content.description: Climbs the slabby arete on the back side of the boulder.
content.location: Starts to the right of the big pocket feature on the back side of the boulder.

content.description: Climbs up the hanging slice of rock. Begin on the hanging rock at a pocket and the arete. Utilize a cool stem to move through the bad sidepull and access some terrible crimps. Bump out left to a good edge and finish up easier terrain to the top.
content.location: Start low, underclinging the point of the hanging rock. The landing is often wet until mid summer when the creek dries out a little.

content.description: One of Exeter's classic boulder problems! Sit start to good edges. Use the obvious undercling to make a heroic reach to slopers at the lip. The landing zone goes under water when the brook floods after heavy rains and during spring snow melt.
content.location: Starts on the gently overhanging face next to the brook.

content.description: V8? Start as for Green Lantern. From the good edge below the underclings, move left to a bad crimp. Grab the sidepull with your right hand, get your feet up and pop to the lip. Base is often wet below the crux so plan on attempting this in dry weather when the creek dries up.
content.location: Sit starts as for Green Lantern on the overhanging face on the upstream side of the boulder. Ends by climbing the upper face left of the Green Lantern.

content.description: This is also the down-climb. Climb the crack and ledge to the top.
content.location: The obvious, easy way up and down found on the down-stream end of the boulder.

content.description: Climbs the right diagonaling crack on the back of the boulder. Sit start at the arete to the right of Green Lantern (as for Lime Light) move up and right along the juggy crack until it ends at a vertical crack (Light Bulb). Layback up the vertical crack to the slab on top.
content.location: The obvious traversing crack at head height on the back of the boulder.

content.description: Climbs the vertical finger crack between Lime Light and Light Bulb.Sit start as for Lime Light and follow the juggy crack (Black Light) rightwards until you can reach up into the finger crack. Gaston or layback the crack to a very thin topout.
content.location: Sit starts below a small overhang on the arete to the left of the vertical finger crack.

content.description: The Lantern Boulder is home to the Exeter classic "Green Lantern". The boulder sits on the banks of Norris Brook right on the edge of the forest.
